item.title: Le Cactus
item.body: A club where you can dance to loud, psychedelic music in a neon ambience!

item.title: Fuse
item.body:
(Techno / House) (gay on some Fridays : www.lademence.com) - Because it's one of the city's techno temples and the biggest names in the field (without exception) have DJ's there, le Fuse is a must for any decent, self-respecting clubber. The unique atmosphere that prevails there attracts those in the know, who come from far and wide. The end-of-the-night crescendos, as things approach hysteria, have become the stuff of near legend. There are also gay evenings on Sundays, as fiendishly good as they are famous on our continent. Supervised free car park and democratic admission fee before midnight.

When: Sat. 11 p.m. till 7 a.m.

item.title: Les Jeux d'Hiver
item.body:
Ever-popular "yuppy" Brussels night-club, the car park is full of convertibles and inside the "Games" attracts girls from a good background and playboys with their Rolex watches.

When : Evenings Thu. and Sat. 8 p.m. till 6 a.m.
item.address: Bois de la Cambre - chemin du Croquet/Ter Kamerenbos - Croquetweg

item.title: Avenue Brussels Night Club
item.body:
Here they chat to the sounds of R’n’B and Funk until the early hours.

When: Thu. – Sat. 10.30 p.m. – 6 a.m.
item.address: av. de la Toison d'Or 44/44 Guldenvlieslaan

item.title: Club Clandestin
item.body: A little disco-bar (400 people even so) in the heart of the Sablon district, frequented by a youth as smart and stylish as you could wish to see. You see some good DJs there too and, when they're in the mood, VIPs. A number of parties are held there at the end of the week. Open from 10 p.m. every Friday and Saturday

item.title: Le You
item.body:
(House / Funk / R'n'b) (gay Sundays) - Le You - it's a psychedelic design on a fuchsia towelling background, it's a house or funky landmark for gorgeous girls. It's also a cosy setting where electro and gay Sundays have successfully established themselves. The indefatigable Olivier Gosseries is the man behind the record deck, a key figure of 'bruxellois' nightlife.

When: 11.30 p.m. till 6 a.m.

item.title: Bazaar
item.body:
Le Bazaar is situated right in the heart of Les Marolles. 

Open 7.30 p.m. to midnight; WE 'til 4 a.m.

item.title: Recyclart
item.body: Specialised electro and underground ambience in this railway station converted into a crazy cultural venue. Open : see website

item.title: Fiesta Club
item.body:
(Not available)
 
Situé dans le centre de Bruxelles, il va s’en dire que le Fiesta Club s’est construit une notoriété en moins d’un an et est aujourd’hui considéré comme un établissement VIP de première classe en Belgique.
Cette discothèque a connu un succès éclatant en s’octroyant le privilège de limiter son ouverture uniquement le vendredi et samedi.
Beaucoup s’accordent à dire, autant les clients que les professionnels du métier, que le niveau est équivalent à celui du VIP ROOM, célèbre franchise d’élite en France fréquentée par la Jet Set internationale.
Plusieurs stars mondiales sont venues le temps d’un soir. Que ce soit du monde de la musique  (50 Cent, Snoop Dogg , Alicia Keys, Ne-Yo, Kelly Rowland) , du cinéma et/ou la télévision (Adam Rodriguez des ’Experts de Miami’ et Arthur, le présentateur vedette de TF1) du sport (Didier Drogba, Franck Ribery) mais aussi de " bons belges " (Jean Claude Van Damme, Vincent Kompany, Mbark Boussoufa et Stromae).
 
Heures d'ouverture: vendredi,samedi et veille de jours fériée 22h à 06h
Tenu correct exigée
Parking surveillé

item.title: The Wood
item.body:
The Wood opened in the heart of the heritage site of the Bois de la Cambre in one of the oldest buildings in the park dating back to 1880.

After a complete renovation of the place, Carl De Moncharline and Serge Vanderheyden have entrusted the interior design to several talented artists.
 
The bar offers a magnificent terrace in the heart of the wood. It welcomes you from Wednesday to Saturday, programming the best DJs to be today's reference for Brussels nightlife.
 
When: 11 p.m. till 6 a.m.

item.title: LA DEMENCE
item.body:
LA DEMENCE is a huge gay party in Brussels that takes place around 12 times a year: mostly on a Friday, or the day before a bank holiday.

What makes La Demence stand out from the other gay parties is the international crowd, and the variety of styles and ages.

As Brussels is strategically placed as a city, LA DEMENCE attracts, beside the local Belgians, a lot of visitors from France, The Netherlands and Germany, as well as hot Italian, Swiss, Spanish, British and American boys. Many make the trip by organized buses from Cologne and Paris, or choose to enjoy the cheap hotel arrangements, offered in the historical center of Brussels, with late check-out coming in handy, as the party carries on until noon!

Not only you will hear many languages spoken, but the mix of different ages and styles partying together will also amaze: leather boys, fashion victims, muscle queens, drags, young and old - in total in excess of 2000 gays having one hell of a party together.

There is no dresscode !

VENUE

The venue, known as techno club FUSE, is huge - containing three different rooms which has the advantage of offering an eclectic range of music delivered by eight international DJs progressing from techno to house, with even a smattering of handbag in the smaller room. Great music and a great crowd also makes La Demence very sensual, so there are a few areas well worth exploring for those looking for more than just a dance. Oh and LA DEMENCE promotes safe-sex!

The only gay party taking place in this venue is called LA DEMENCE On other dates it is regular club!

On special party week-ends, some LA DEMENCE parties are also organized in other venues

25th Years Party Week-end

FLIGHT to LA DEMENCE for less

Brussels Airlines is offering you 10% discount on flights (b.Flex and b.Light) to Brussels from over 40 European destinations, and Moscow and Tel Aviv.
For bookings: departure possible from Wednesday before the party and return possible until Wednesday after the party

Book on www.brusselsairlines.com and enter this promotion code " 11116589" BEFORE clicking the "book now" button.

item.title: Spirito Brussels
item.body:
In an innovative decor made of crystal and gold, the Spirito Martini offers a huge dance floor around which the corners of relaxation lounge, three different bars, and many private areas popular with the square of the famous brand Dom Perignon .. . In a sumptuous, sleek, unique design, the centerpiece is a chandelier be imposing in real Murano glass! Tinted glass railings, mirrors, clean lines. Particular attention was paid to the lighting within the space where the lighting RGB creates a unique atmosphere and mysterious. . Indeed in a report by the edge channel 7, the Spirito Martini has been ranked as one of the most beautiful bar club in the world ..

When: WE. 10.30 p.m. till 6 a.m.

item.title: HUNKUT/INTOX @ Steelgate
item.body: The monthly hot & fetish party with international djs.

item.title: Bloody Louis
item.body: After a very short-lived appearance of GotaClub the Louise gallery welcomes a new nightclub: the Bloody Louis. This newcomer seeks to pull ahead of the competition and offer clubbers a different kind of experience. Deliberately atypical, the atmosphere is extremely masculine (leather chesterfields, football table, pinball machine...) and unconventional. Worth a try!

item.title: Sett club
item.body:
The adjectives to describe a memorable evening are inadequate to sum up the atmosphere at Sett - Where Nights Come Alive.
 
Located at Tour & Taxis, Sett invites you to a quiet place, easy to reach, far from the usual city center, thus avoiding traffic jams and endless searches parking. It's infrastructure is well thought out and the vast building's exceptional architecture welcomes you in a unique space for quality evenings while maintaining a selected clientele.
 
If you were disappointed by events where it was impossible to enjoy the music beat, either too strong or otherwise virtually absent. Sett takes responsibility to marvel you in the fine sound quality and its selection of DJ's.
 
Indeed, our residential DJ's were chosen among the best in Belgium, but we go even further by offering and inviting international guests and unprecedented artists. If you are still not convinced, theme evenings and concepts such as the memorable Next Level, the mad Buddha Circus, the retro Disco Moustache, the long awaited comeback of the RedCup Party, Feelin' Deep & House Nation proposed at Sett, are promised to eventually dazzle you with their distinctive atmosphere. Are you Sett?
